result.execSummary:
The defendant Miranda A. Grace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Miranda A. Grace is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Miranda A. Grace was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Miranda A. Grace was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant enroll in & successfully complete drug addiciton treatment through C.A.R.E. Program, including Vivitrol shots as recommended.  Counseling per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miranda A. Grace in custody and in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Atty Middleton is in agreement.  15CF271 - Atty Middleton waives her right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Middleton acknowledges rec. information in 15CF271/waives reading.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Poss. Heroin 961.41(3g)(am).  Court so amends.  Atty Middleton enters NC pleas to 15CF271 as amended and Cts 2 and 3 in 15CF326.   DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State notices the victim was noticed and provided a VIS but doesn't appear today.  Parties review the VIS from one of the dismissed/read-in cases.  Atty Middleton makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

15CF326
Ct 1:  Dismissed
Cts 2 and 3:  NC
Probation for 24 months on each count concurrent to each other and 15CF271
Conditions of probation:
Care Program treatment program including vivitrol shots
$443.00 x 2 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
Counseling per agent

15CF271
Ct 1:  NC - ***amended to possession of heroin as a class I felony 961.41(3g)(am)***
Probation for 30 months concurrent to 15CF326
Conditions of probation:
Drug addiction counseling and programming thru Care Program including vivitrol shots
6 months jail STAYED as long as DE is in compliance w/probation conditions
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
$100.00 to SCDTF
Counseling per agent
If successful on probation the matter may be expunged under 973.015***

15CM149 - Dismissed/read-in

14CM560 - Dismissed/read-in

Defendant Miranda A. Grace in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Middleton request matter be reset.  New pending case.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Miranda A. Grace in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Miranda A. Grace in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status.  Request reset to Friday.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Miranda A. Grace appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify for PD.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State request large cash bond of $2500.00.  Criminal history and bail jumping.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Defendant does qualify.  Time limits waived.  $300.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
